text: Alden is a city in Rice County, Kansas, United States. In 2020 census, 122 people lived there. ==History== Alden was created in 1872. It was a station on the Atchison, Topeka and Santa Fe Railway. Alden was named after Alden Speare, a railroad employee. The first post office in Alden was established in 1882. ==Geography== Alden is at (38.243839, -98.31173). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of . All of it is land. ==People== ===2020 census=== The 2020 census says that there were 122 people, 39 households, and 28 families living in Alden. Of the households, 89.7% owned their home and 10.3% rented their home. The median age was 48.7 years. Of the people, 94.3% were White, 0.8% were Black, 0.8% were Native American, 0.8% were from some other race, and 3.3% were two or more races. Hispanic or Latino of any race were 1.6% of the people. ===2010 census=== The 2010 census says that there were 148 people, 61 households, and 47 families living in Alden. ==References== ==Other websites== ;City * Alden - Directory of Public Officials ;Schools * USD 376, local school district ;Maps * Rice County Map , KDOT Category:Cities in Rice County, Kansas Category:1872 establishments in Kansas
title: Alden, Kansas
